name: Rails-todos
body: # Rails ToDos An implemnation of the classic todo item manager application with a Ruby on Rails backend and a Backbone.js frontend. Note: This is a Rails 3.1 application. ## Installation Install Ruby (preferably through RVM) by entering the following in a terminal. $ curl -L https://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable --ruby After RVM installs, add the following to your bash profile to ensure RVM is loaded into every new shell session [[ -s "/Users/{{ YOUR USERNAME }}/.rvm/scripts/rvm" ]] && source "/Users/{{ YOUR USERNAME }}/.rvm/scripts/rvm" Install Ruby 1.9.3. rvm install ruby-1.9.3-rc1 ## Quick Start Install Bundler gem install bundler Inside of the applications directory install the gem bundle specified in the Gemfile bundle (Which is a shortcut for 'bundle install' Create the database and populate it with tables. bundle exec rake db:create db:migrate Start the server bundle exec rails server Go to http://localhost:3000 to open the application. ## Running The Tests The first time, create the test database. bundle exec rake db:test:prepare The application has three sets of tests: Cucumber integration test, RSpec isolation specs for Rails components, and Jasmine isolation specs for Backbone components. To run them all at once. bundle rake Or run them one at a time bundle rake cucumber bundle rake spec bundle rake jasmine
tagline: An implemnation of the classic todo item manager application with a Ruby on Rails (3.1) backend and a Backbone.js frontend.
